[LIST_ITEM] 2 plasma membranes connected by a series of structures made up of connexons
[LIST_ITEM] 2 connexons in register forming open channels between the two membranes
[LIST_ITEM] Electrical resistance is determined by number of junctions that are expressed
[LIST_ITEM] Junctions increase at time of parturition
[LIST_ITEM] Connexin-43 has high turnover rate in labor
[LIST_ITEM] Good temporal relationship between intracellular Ca++ and development of force
[LIST_ITEM] Ca++-calmodulin activate myosin light chain kinase (MLCK)
[LIST_ITEM] This phosphorylates a serine residue (Ser 19) in the 20 kDa light chain of myosin (MLC20)
[LIST_ITEM] Phosphorylated myosin interacts with actin and causes a contraction
[LIST_ITEM] When Ca++ is removed phosphorylation ceases and the muscle relaxes
[LIST_ITEM] Bundle of myometrial cells embedded in a matrix of connective tissue
[LIST_ITEM] Matrix enables transmission of individual contractile forces
[LIST_ITEM] Ripening occurs in the cervix and corpus
[LIST_ITEM] 4 light chains (two 20 kDa chains and two 15-17 kDa chains)
[LIST_ITEM] Enzyme capable of converting ATP → mechanical energy

[LIST_ITEM] First peptide ever synthesized - Nobel Prize
[LIST_ITEM] Act by raising intracellular free calcium levels
[LIST_ITEM] Calcium stimulates actomyosin formation and muscular contraction

Oxytocin receptors distributed in a gradient from fundus (maximum) to cervix (few) Receptor concentration begins to rise early in pregnancy and exponentially increases to term
[LIST_ITEM] Produce numerous physiologic and pathophysiologic effects
[LIST_ITEM] Regulating cellular processes in nearly every tissue
[LIST_ITEM] act in the vicinity of their site of production
[LIST_ITEM] Function in an autocrine and/or paracrine manner
[LIST_ITEM] Can be formed by nearly every tissue and cell type
[LIST_ITEM] Ability to provoke different responses in various tissues
[LIST_ITEM] Wide spectrum of physiological and pharmacological actions
[LIST_ITEM] Contraction and relaxation of smooth muscle
[LIST_ITEM] Exert their effects through GTP-binding protein (G protein)-coupled, rhodopsin-type receptors
[LIST_ITEM] Receptors for PGE2 are termed EP, which include EP1, EP2, EP3 and EP4 subtypes
[LIST_ITEM] High specific PGE2 binding has been observed in the brain, kidney, uterus, liver, thymus and the adrenal medulla
[LIST_ITEM] PGE2 has versatile and opposing actions due to multiple EP receptor subtypes and the coupling of EP receptor isoforms to a variety of signal transduction pathways
[LIST_ITEM] Endogenous PGE2 regulates the growth of epithelial cells
[LIST_ITEM] PGE2 exhibits mitogenic activities in bone cells and stimulates DNA synthesis
[LIST_ITEM] PGE2 is involved in the growth and metastasis of tumors
[LIST_ITEM] Inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis has been shown to result in growth retardation of tumors in experimental animals
[LIST_ITEM] Decreased risk of colon cancer with ASA
[LIST_ITEM] Major protein of the extracellular matrix
[LIST_ITEM] Proline and glycine bonds create the left handed helical configuration
[LIST_ITEM] I, II, III are fibrillar collagens
[LIST_ITEM] Assemble into fibrils and then fibers
[LIST_ITEM] Collagen polypeptides formed on membrane bound ribosomes and injected into the ER as pro-α chains (have extra amnio-acids called pro-peptides at ends)
[LIST_ITEM] In lumen of ER hydroxyproline allows bonding of three pro-α chains to form procollagen
[LIST_ITEM] Propeptides of type I, II, and III removed by extracellular enzymes converting them to tropocollagen (1.5 nm diameter)
[LIST_ITEM] Tropocollagen assembles to form fibrils (10-200 nm)
[LIST_ITEM] Total collagen increases but concentration goes down 30-50%
[LIST_ITEM] Stains for collagen polymer show reduced amount (lower numbers of intact fibers)
[LIST_ITEM] Total collagen increases but concentration goes down 30-50%
[LIST_ITEM] Stains for collagen polymer show reduced amount (lower numbers of intact fibers)
[LIST_ITEM] Glucosamine - naturally occurring amino sugar found in glycosoaminoglycans (mucopolysaccharides)
[LIST_ITEM] An immediate precursor for glycosaminoglycan synthesis
[LIST_ITEM] Stimulates incorporation of other precursors into the connective tissue matrix
[LIST_ITEM] HA may bind water and help hydration of tissue and hence deformability
[LIST_ITEM] Results in decreased rigidity of cervical tissue
[LIST_ITEM] Elastase acts on the telopeptide non-helical domains of collagen
[LIST_ITEM] Can degrade collagen, elastin, and proteoglycans
[LIST_ITEM] Amount of soluble collagen (degraded) increases in parallel with enzyme activity
[LIST_ITEM] Collagen with many x-links replaced with collagen with fewer x-links
[LIST_ITEM] Up to several thousand sugar residues
[LIST_ITEM] Repeating sequence of non-sulfated disaccharide units
[LIST_ITEM] Variable amounts in all tissues (esp embryos)
[LIST_ITEM] Has some function in cell migration
[LIST_ITEM] IL-8, other cytokines, eosinophils, mast cells, macrophages, neutrophils
[LIST_ITEM] IL-8 in rabbits is down regulated by progesterone
[LIST_ITEM] Changes are gradual and antecede labor by several weeks
